text.value: I have deployed my app to Heroku, and it's not deploying properly, can you help me figure out why?

Certainly! I'd be happy to help you troubleshoot your Heroku deployment. Based on the codebase context provided, it appears you have a Flask backend and a React frontend. Here are a few steps we can take to diagnose the issue:
1. Check your Heroku logs: Run `heroku logs --tail` in your terminal to see real-time logs. This can provide valuable information about any errors occurring during deployment or runtime.
2. Ensure you have a Procfile: Create a file named `Procfile` (no extension) in your root directory if you haven't already. It should contain the command to run your Flask app, like: `web: gunicorn backend.app:app`.
3. Verify your requirements.txt: Make sure all necessary Python packages are listed in your `requirements.txt` file, including Flask, gunicorn, and any other dependencies.
4. Check your package.json: Ensure it includes a "heroku-postbuild" script to build your React app, like: `"heroku-postbuild": "cd frontend && npm install && npm run build"`.
5. Configure your Flask app: Modify your Flask app to serve the React build files. You've already set this up in your `app.py`, which is great.
6. Set up environment variables: If you're using any environment variables, make sure they're properly set in your Heroku config.
7. Check your Heroku buildpacks: Ensure you have both the Python and Node.js buildpacks added to your Heroku app.
If you've done all of these and are still having issues, please provide more specific information about the error you're seeing, and I'd be glad to help further!
